wikipedia_page.main: John Edward Rhodes (13 February 1870 – 6 February 1947) was an English sailor who competed in the 1908 Summer Olympics for Great Britain. He was a crew member of the British boat Cobweb, which won the gold medal in the 8 metre class.

response: * John Rhodes (17th century), theatrical figure in London

* John Rhodes (sailor) (1870–1947), British Olympic gold medalist in 1908
* John Rhodes (mathematician) (born 1937), co-developer of Krohn–Rhodes theory
* John Rhodes (Canadian politician) (1929–1978), Member of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario for Sault Ste. Marie, 1971–1978
* John Rhodes (basketball) (born 1965), American basketball coach and player

In the 1908 Olympic Games, Cochrane and his brothers-in-law, Henry Sutton and John Rhodes, raced in Cochrane's yacht, Cobweb, that won the 8-metre class.
